definition: Structured mathematical or logical statements with precise symbolic representation or systematic form

positive_examples: The quadratic formula x = (-b ± √(b²-4ac))/2a solves second-degree equations
Euclid's first axiom states that a straight line can be drawn between any two points
The graph shows the relationship between temperature and pressure using coordinate axes
Einstein's field equations model the curvature of spacetime in general relativity
The network diagram represents nodes connected by directed edges
The postulate assumes that electric charge is conserved in all interactions
negative_examples: I believe that honesty is the best policy in relationships
The hypothesis suggests that birds migrate due to seasonal changes
My opinion is that this movie deserves an award
The theory proposes that consciousness emerges from neural complexity
She argued that the policy would benefit small businesses
The claim states that exercise improves mental health
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Hypothesis, Theory, Belief, Opinion
